verbose_text: After poisoning with Amanita phalloides in beagles, silibinin administration (50 mg/kg) 5 and 24 hours after intoxication markedly reduced hemorrhagic necrosis induced in the liver and more effectively prevented death in all of the silibinin treated dogs compared with controls.
evidence: silibinin administration (50 mg/kg) 5 and 24 hours after intoxication markedly reduced hemorrhagic necrosis induced in the liver and more effectively prevented death
